newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil sees privatization tenders by Q1 1998.
newsitem.headline: Brazil sees privatization tenders by Q1 1998.

text.p: Brazil Communications Minister Sergio Motta said he expected tender details for the privatization of Telesp and Embratel to be ready by the first quarter of 1998.

Motta said he expected Congress to approve a law laying down the framework for telecommunications privatiations by the end of June. A month later, the National Development Bank would open bidding for contracts to advise on the privatizations of Telesp and Embratel, the first two Telebras units slated to be sold off, he said.
Motta, addressing a seminar on telecommunications privatizations, said tenders for the selloff of three remaining regional telecommunications companies should be published around July 1998.
The degree of foreign ownership permitted in the regional companies and in Embratel would be decided on a case by case basis by the president of the republic, he said.

Motta reiterated government expectations of raising $100 billion through the sale of the nation's telecommunications system. "The system will not be sold for anything less than $100 billion reais," Motta said.
The minister said the upcoming sale of concessions to operate B Band cellular services would raise about $5 billion reais.
